title: Ole Miss quarterback Grant Tisdale leaves program, enters NCAA transfer portal
text:
CLOSE SportsPulse: Paul Myerberg gives us his opinion on which players over the course of college football's history may have been snubbed for the Heisman Trophy. USA TODAY

OXFORD, Miss. — Quarterback Grant Tisdale has left the Ole Miss football program as of Tuesday.

Tisdale was a four-star signee out of Texas who joined Ole Miss' Class of 2019 alongside fellow quarterbacks John Rhys Plumlee and Kinkead Dent. Tisdale has played in one game this season, going 2-for-2 with 56 yards and a touchdown against Alabama. He also ran twice for 10 yards.

The Clarion Ledger could not reach Tisdale for comment Tuesday when news broke of his departure.

Throughout spring practice, Tisdale took a majority of the practice reps with the second team during the media viewing sessions of practice. When the team reconvened for fall practice and Plumlee joined the team, Plumlee and Tisdale split most of the second-team reps.

Tisdale met with the media last Wednesday and gave no indication of his intent to transfer. He did, however, say he intended to go home to Texas for the bye week.

Rivals.com insider EJ Holland reported Tuesday night that Tisdale had entered the transfer portal. Tisdale's father, Mike, liked and retweeted multiple posts on Twitter about his son's decision.

Tisdale committed to Ole Miss on April 6, 2018, and signed with the Rebels in December. He did not report any other official visits after his commitment, but had previously reported offers from Baylor, SMU, Houston and Oklahoma State, as well as Ohio State, Oregon and Utah.

Tisdale had three SEC offers: Ole Miss, Mississippi State and Tennessee.

Ole Miss quarterback Grant Tisdale during Fall Camp in Oxford, MS, on Saturday, Aug. 3, 2019. Photo by Petre Thomas/Ole Miss Athletics Instagram and Twitter: @OleMissPix Buy Photos at RebelWallArt.com (Photo: Petre Thomas, Ole Miss Athletics)

Ole Miss senior cornerback Jaylon Jones, who like Tisdale attended Allen High School, said he learned about Tisdale's decision Tuesday.

"Grant's my guy so I wish him nothing but the best," Jones said. "I support what he did. It is what it is. I just know great things are going to come his way."

With Tisdale out of the program, Ole Miss' remaining scholarship quarterbacks are Plumlee, Dent and redshirt freshman Matt Corral. The Rebels also have four-star quarterback Robby Ashford committed for the Class of 2020.
description: Ole Miss quarterback Grant Tisdale, a four-star recruit from their 2019 class, has left the program and entered the NCAA transfer portal.
